poem:
Title: "Roi: A Flower Wilted"

Bright life extinguished,  
a lament spreads through Darlington.  
Young Roi fades to ash,  
driven to dark corners  
by harsh words and harder hands.   
Sports star, bright mind, lost.  
In dust she sleeps. In  
silence, we weep, while coroners  
meet muted truths with closed eyes.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Domestic abuse drove our daughters to suicide, say families. So what stops coroners acknowledging that? Roisin, the only child of Dr Tony Bennett and Margaret Hunter, went to her bedroom in Darlington on 7 March 2022 and attempted to take her own life. She died in hospital nine days later, at the age of 19. Roisin, known as “Roi”, excelled at sports; she was popular and had received high marks as one of the youngest". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
